entries.title: Checking Social Media Habitually May Affect Adolescent Brain Development: Study
entries.description: According to a national study authored by Dr. Brain Primack, dean of the College of Education and Health Professions and professor of public health at the University of Arkansas, “Young adults who increased their use of social media were significantly more likely to develop depression within six months.” (ShutterStock)

entries.title: Apple Looses $1 Trillion in Market Value in a Year
entries.description: The Apple Inc. logo at the entrance to the Apple store in Brussels on Nov. 28, 2022. (Yves Herman/Reuters)
